Articles.Content:
Hi Folks:

New Kerbonaut, and second time poster.

I feel as if I've come home in a weird way.

Thirty years ago there was this space station construction game on the Commodore 64. In fact, I think it was called "Space Station." I spent days at this game, and one of my memories is spending all day in my bedroom working on a station and hearing my mother downstairs say to my sister, "Call your brother to dinner." 

And my sister yells, "RICK! GET DOWN HERE FOR DINNER NOW!"

My mother says, "Well, I could have done that!"

My sister answers, "Mom! He's been playing that game all day. He's only left his bedroom to go to the bathroom!"

The problem was...she was totally right.

And now, its happening again. Which is dangerous because now I have, like, a real job, and everything.

See you all in space!
---
Doc Kinne

Hello kinnerc and welcome to the KSP Forums!

While I don't remember that particular game, I remember the era well.  Playing various text-based games on my buddy's TRS-80.  Getting my Amiga 1000.

Those were the days.  Glad to have you aboard.


Happy landings!

Hey Kinnerc! Welcome to the KSP community.

I actually own a working C64 and Amiga 500, but don't have the know-how to operate the C64  

BASIC sure would be easier to learn back in the day (especially when it was taught in schools).
